sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Karpath to Schenker, dated February 7, 1916
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Karpath informs Schenker that the latter is expected by Dr. Kammerer the following day, before Kammerer addresses the court.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Gericht; court

tei:div.tei:p:
Dr: Emil Kammerer Krugerstraße 17 (Tel. 1228)
erwartet Sie morgen Vormittags um elf UhrReceipt of this note is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 2/1, p. 129, February 7, 1916: "Abends Brief von Karpath mit Nominierung Dr. Kammerers, zu dem ich am nächsten Morgen gehen sollte." ("That evening, letter from Karpath with Dr. Kammerer's nomination; I was to go to him [Kammerer] the next morning."). — Blindengasse 46, Vienna VIII: the address of the Divisional Court of the Home Guard (see Lehmann 1916, vol. I, p. 152). und geht dann sofort in die Blindengasse.The meeting is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 2/1, p. 130, February 8, 1916: "An ½ 11h zu Dr. Kammerer, muss bis ¾ 12h warten. Hernach kurze Instruktion, wieder unter dem Gesichtspunkt rücksichtsloser Kürze, doch gelingt es mir, dem Verteidiger die Formel herzubringen, die ich schon dem Protokollführer gegenüber angewendet habe u. die möglicherweise von entscheidender Kraft sein dürfte." ("To Dr. Kammerer at 10.30, but was obliged to wait until 11.45. After that, short briefing, with a view to brevity at all costs. But I succeeded in impressing on the defense attorney the form of words that I had previously used against the Clerk of the Court, and that might possibly be of decisive force."). Nachm. amtiert das Gericht nicht, wir verlören einen Tag.

Dr. Emil Kammerer Krugerstraße 17 (Tel. 1228)
is expecting you tomorrow morning at 11 o'clock and will then go immediately to the Blindengasse. The court does not sit in the afternoon, so we would lose a day.
